intro: Phyteuma charmelioides, commonly known as the purple marsh carnation, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to deep purple. The plant typically grows in wet meadows, marshes, and along stream banks, preferring moist, well-drained soils. It produces a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, upright stem. Phyteuma charmelioides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and wetland restoration projects.
